inputs.name: licenseFile
inputs.label: Fortify SCA license file
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the Fortify SCA license is specified, it will overwrite the current Fortify SCA license on the build agent.

inputs.name: runBuildTranslate
inputs.label: Run Fortify SCA translation
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, runs the translation phase.

inputs.name: applicationType
inputs.label: Application type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of application to be analyzed.

inputs.name: fortifyProjects
inputs.label: Projects for Fortify SCA analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: The relative path to the project or solution to scan with Fortify SCA. Wildcards can be used. For example, `**\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: buildClasspath
inputs.label: Classpath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the path to look for jars/classes for class resolution.

inputs.name: buildSourceVersion
inputs.label: Source version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the JDK version used for the source code.

inputs.name: buildSourcePath
inputs.label: Sourcepath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the location of source files which will not be included in the scan but will be used for name resolution. Equivalent to the -sourcepath option to javac. Path is relative to the project root.

inputs.name: buildAnalyzerParams
inputs.label: Additional Fortify SCA translation options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional parameters to pass to sourceanalyzer during the translation process.

inputs.name: buildToolOptions
inputs.label: Build tool options
inputs.helpMarkDown: These options are used when integrating Micro Focus Fortify SCA with a build tool. The build tool (e.g. Maven, Gradle, etc.) must be on the agent's PATH.

inputs.name: fortifySourceTranslate
inputs.label: Source files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Expressions denoting a file or a group of files (one per line), optionally matching a pattern. For example, path/file1.java - a single file, path/file*.java - files matching an expression, path/**/*.java - recursive expression matches. Paths are relative to the project root. This is ignored if build tool options are used.

inputs.name: fortifyOtherTranslate
inputs.label: Additional files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the location of any additional files for Fortify SCA to analyze with this scan. Full paths are allowed. This is ignored if build tool options are used.

inputs.name: fortifyBuildId
inputs.label: Build ID for Fortify SCA
inputs.helpMarkDown: The build ID is used to track which files are compiled and linked as part of a build and later to scan those files.

inputs.name: runFortifyRulepackUpdate
inputs.label: Update Fortify Security Content
inputs.helpMarkDown: Compares installed security content to the most current version and updates your installation security content by downloading the latest Micro Focus Fortify Secure Coding Rulepacks and metadata from the Fortify Customer Portal.

inputs.name: runFortifyClean
inputs.label: Run SCA clean
inputs.helpMarkDown: Clears the build ID and all associated intermediate data for that build ID from the previous scan.

inputs.name: scaVerbose
inputs.label: Enable verbose logging
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run Fortify SCA in verbose logging mode.

inputs.name: scaDebug
inputs.label: Enable debug logging
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run Fortify SCA in debug logging mode.

inputs.name: runFortifyScan
inputs.label: Run Fortify SCA scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, runs the scan (analysis) phase.

inputs.name: fortifyScanType
inputs.label: Scan type
inputs.helpMarkDown: To run a scan on your local machine, select Local. To run a scan on distributed machines, select ScanCentral.

inputs.name: additionalScanParams
inputs.label: Additional Fortify SCA scan options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional parameters to be used for the scan.

inputs.name: customFortifyRulepacks
inputs.label: Custom Rulepacks
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a custom Rulepack or directory. If you specify a directory, includes all of the files in the directory with the .bin and .xml extensions.

inputs.name: runFortifyUpload
inputs.label: Upload results to SSC
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled, the SCA result will be transmitted to the application version in SSC that is specified below.

inputs.name: fortifyServerName
inputs.label: Fortify SSC service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the SSC service connection in your project.

inputs.name: fortifyApplicationName
inputs.label: SSC application name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SSC application name. Application names in SSC are case-sensitive.

inputs.name: fortifyApplicationVersion
inputs.label: SSC application version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SSC application version. Application versions in SSC are case-sensitive.

inputs.name: fortifyApplicationVersionId
inputs.label: SSC application version ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SSC application version ID. The application version ID is a numeric value.

inputs.name: uploadProxyURL
inputs.label: Proxy URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Proxy server URL (ex: https://proxy.example.com:8080)

inputs.name: scanCentralAdditionalScanParams
inputs.label: Additional scan options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Fortify SCA scan options.

inputs.name: scanCentralCustomFortifyRulepacks
inputs.label: Custom Rulepacks
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies a custom Rulepack or directory. If you specify a directory, includes all of the files in the directory with the .bin and .xml extensions.

inputs.name: scanCentralFortifyServerName
inputs.label: Fortify SSC service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the SSC service connection in your project.

inputs.name: scanCentralRunFortifyUpload
inputs.label: Upload results to SSC
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this check box to upload the scan results to the application version in Fortify Software Security Center.

inputs.name: scanCentralFortifyApplicationName
inputs.label: SSC application name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SSC application name. Application names in SSC are case-sensitive.

inputs.name: scanCentralFortifyApplicationVersion
inputs.label: SSC application version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SSC application version. Application versions in SSC are case-sensitive.

inputs.name: scanCentralFortifyApplicationVersionId
inputs.label: SSC application version ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the SSC application version ID. The application version ID is a numeric value.

inputs.name: fortifyBuildFailureCriteria
inputs.label: Build failure criteria
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a search query to trigger a build failure. For example, the search query '[fortify priority order]:critical' causes the build to fail if any critical issues exist in the analysis results.

inputs.name: taskResultForBuildFailureCriteria
inputs.label: Task result when build failure criteria is met
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the task result when the build failure criteria is met.

inputs.name: timeoutForPollingArtifactState
inputs.label: Polling timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify how long (in minutes) to poll Fortify Software Security Center to check if FPR processing is complete. The valid values are 0 to 10080. A timeout value of 0 causes the polling to continue until FPR processing finishes or stops due to errors.

inputs.name: intervalForPollingArtifactState
inputs.label: Polling interval
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify how frequently (in minutes) to poll the Fortify Software Security Center server to determine if the FPR processing is complete. The valid values are 1 to 60.

messages.version.failure: You must have Fortify Static Code Analyzer version 16.11 or later installed. It may also be necessary to restart the agent from a new command-window or restart the agent service so any changes to executable PATH environment are visible to the agent.
